title: Cell-Free Protein Synthesis Reaction Setup
author: Opentrons
description: With this protocol, your robot can generate cell-free protein synthesis reaction setup using information uploaded in a CSV. The CSV contains volumes of each reagent that should be dispensed into the each of destination well. Please see format of the CSV in Additional Notes.
process:
Upload your volume CSV.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
Robot will distribute water to each well.
Robot will mix extract 5 times, then distribute extract to each well. Extract will be mixed twice before each aspiration.
Robot will mix DNA 5 times, then distribute extract to each well. DNA will be mixed twice before each aspiration.
The robot will distribute each buffer from group 1 to the appropriate well.
The robot will distribute each buffer from group 2 to the appropriate well.
The robot will distribute each buffer from group 3 to the appropriate well.
The robot will mix solution A 10 times, then distribute to groups of 8 wells. A new tip will be used and solution will be mixed 5 times before each aspiration.
The robot will mix solution B 15 times, then distribute to groups of 8 wells. A new tip will be used and solution will be mixed 10 times before each aspiration.
The robot will mix each PCR tube twice. A new tip will be used for every 4 tubes.
notes: Make sure to follow this CSV Format:

markdown.title: Cell-Free Protein Synthesis Reaction Setup
markdown.author: [Opentrons](http://www.opentrons.com/)
markdown.description: With this protocol, your robot can generate cell-free protein synthesis reaction setup using information uploaded in a CSV. The CSV contains volumes of each reagent that should be dispensed into the each of destination well. Please see format of the CSV in Additional Notes.
markdown.reagents:
* Water: well A1
* Extract: well B1
* DNA: well C1
* Buffer 1 (A-E): well D1-D2
* Buffer 2 (A-E): well A3-A4
* Buffer 3 (A-E): well B4-B5
* Solution A: well C5
* Solution B: well D5
markdown.process:
1. Upload your volume CSV.
2. Download your protocol.
3. Upload your protocol into the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
4. Set up your deck according to the deck map.
5. Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our [support article](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-2/getting-started-software-setup/deck-calibration).
6. Hit "Run".
7. Robot will distribute water to each well.
8. Robot will mix extract 5 times, then distribute extract to each well. Extract will be mixed twice before each aspiration.
9. Robot will mix DNA 5 times, then distribute extract to each well. DNA will be mixed twice before each aspiration.
10. The robot will distribute each buffer from group 1 to the appropriate well.
11. The robot will distribute each buffer from group 2 to the appropriate well.
12. The robot will distribute each buffer from group 3 to the appropriate well.
13. The robot will mix solution A 10 times, then distribute to groups of 8 wells. A new tip will be used and solution will be mixed 5 times before each aspiration.
14. The robot will mix solution B 15 times, then distribute to groups of 8 wells. A new tip will be used and solution will be mixed 10 times before each aspiration.
15. The robot will mix each PCR tube twice. A new tip will be used for every 4 tubes.
markdown.notes:
* Make sure to follow this CSV Format:

![csv_format](https://s3.amazonaws.com/opentrons-protocol-library-website/custom-README-images/1251-california-polytechnic-state-university-slo/csv_format.png)
